property.name: consent_text_6
property.default: The MindCrowd Research Study
property.label: The MindCrowd Research Study

property.name: consent_text_7
property.default: Information and Frequently Asked Questions
property.label: Information and Frequently Asked Questions

property.name: consent_text_8
property.default: MindCrowd is a scientific research study. To participate, please read the following information and agree by checking the box below. Press the 'I agree' button to continue.
property.label: I agree button to continue

property.name: consent_text_11
property.default: By checking this box I confirm that:I am 18 years of age or older,I have read and understand the information above and I want to participate in this research study, and â€‹I realize that this test cannot diagnose or predict future risk of cognitive decline, Alzheimer's disease, or any other dementia
property.label: Checking Confirm

property.name: consent01
property.default: Please click on the checkbox at the bottom of the page before pressing the 'I Agree' button.
property.label: Consent01

property.name: consent02
property.default: Please read the following information before agreeing to participate in this research study.
property.label: Consent02

property.name: consent03
property.default: This research study is conducted by Dr. Matt Huentelman at the Translational Genomics Research Institute (or TGen) in Phoenix, Arizona.
property.label: consent03

property.name: consent04
property.default: The purpose of this study is to understand the factors that influence how the brain ages. We are interested in factors such as your lifestyle choices, your medical or family history, and even your genetic make-up. If we better understand how the brain ages, we may be able to understand what happens to people who experience an age-related brain disease (like Alzheimer's disease).
property.label: consent04

property.name: consent05
property.default: What will I have to do?
property.label: What will I have to do?

property.name: consent06
property.default: You will take one attention test and one memory test, and answer a few study-related questions.
property.label: consent06

property.name: consent07
property.default: How will you use my information?
property.label: consent07

property.name: consent08
property.default: We will use it to study, analyze, and understand how memory works in healthy people.
property.label: consent08

property.name: consent09
property.default: We may contact you again for future brain studies. Most studies will be performed online.
property.label: consent09

property.name: consent10
property.default: How old do I have to be to participate?
property.label: consent10

property.name: consent11
property.default: 18 years old or older.
property.label: consent11

property.name: consent12
property.default: What are my alternatives to being in this study?
property.label: consent12

property.name: consent13
property.default: This is not a treatment study. Your alternative is not to participate.
property.label: Enter the title

property.name: consent14
property.default: Are there any risks?
property.label: consent14

property.name: consent15
property.default: No
property.label: consent15

property.name: consent16
property.default: Will I get paid?
property.label: consent16

property.name: consent17
property.default: Does it cost me anything to participate?
property.label: consent17

property.name: consent18
property.default: Will you share my study data?
property.label: consent18

property.name: consent19
property.default: Sharing research data with other scientists is an important part of the research process and helps advance scientific progress. We will share de-identified data from this study with other researchers to help further research into the human brain.
property.label: consent19

property.name: consent20
property.default: Will you share my personal information with other people?
property.label: consent20

property.name: consent21
property.default: No, we will not share your personal information without your permission. If you consent to participate in a MindCrowd collaborative study (or have previously done so), we may share or receive identifiable data such as your name or email address with our collaborative partners. This would only be done to link your study data. Your information could also be shared with the FDA and the IRB overseeing this study.
property.label: consent21

property.name: consent22
property.default: To help protect your privacy, we have obtained a Certificate of Confidentiality from the National Institutes of Health. This means researchers may refuse to give out study information that identifies you. For example, if there were a court order requesting your study records, TGen would not give out information that identifies you, unless you have consented for this use. The Certificate does permit TGen to disclose your information when:
property.label: consent22

property.name: consent23
property.default: Required by Federal, State, or local laws. This excludes instances of Federal, State, or local civil, criminal, administrative, legislative, or other proceedings;
property.label: consent23

property.name: consent24
property.default: You have consented to the disclosure, including for your medical treatment;
property.label: consent24

property.name: consent25
property.default: Done as part of other approved research studies.
property.label: consent25

property.name: consent26
property.default: A Certificate of Confidentiality does not prevent you or someone else, like a member of your family, from voluntarily sharing information about yourself or your involvement in this research. If you want your research information released to an insurer, medical care provider, or any other person not connected with the research, you must provide consent to allow the researchers to release it.
property.label: consent26

property.name: consent27
property.default: What if I change my mind and don't want to participate in the study anymore?
property.label: consent27

property.name: consent28
property.default: Your participation is completely voluntary. You do not have to participate and you may stop at any time. Your decision will not result in any penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled. Please contact the Study Coordinator at crc@tgen.org to withdraw from the study.
property.label: consent28

property.name: consent29
property.default: What if I have questions or comments?
property.label: consent29

property.name: consent30
property.default: If you have any questions, concerns or complaints about this research, you may contact Dr. Matt Huentelman at mhuentelman@tgen.org or 602-343-8653 (24 hours).
property.label: consent30

property.name: consent31
property.default: Will you contact me in the future?
property.label: consent31

property.name: consent32
property.default: We may contact you in the future via email to offer you to participate in new scientific research studies. Participation in any of our studies is completely voluntary.
property.label: consent32

property.name: consent33
property.default: What if I have questions about my rights in this research, have a complaint, or want to report a problem to someone besides the researcher?
property.label: consent33

property.name: consent34
property.default: If you have questions about your rights as a research participant in this study or if you have questions, concerns or complaints about the research, you may contact WCG IRB at:
property.label: consent34

property.name: consent35
property.default: 1019 39th Avenue SE Suite 120
property.label: consent35

property.name: consent36
property.default: Puyallup, Washington 98374-2115
property.label: consent36

property.name: consent37
property.default: Telephone: 855-818-2289
property.label: consent37

property.name: consent38
property.default: E-mail:
property.label: consent38

property.name: consent39
property.default: researchquestions@wcgirb.com
property.label: consent39

property.name: consent40
property.default: WCG IRB is a group of people who perform independent review of research.
property.label: consent40

property.name: consent41
property.default: For questions, concerns, suggestions, complaints that are not being addressed by the research team, or in case of research-related harm, please contact the TGen Office of Research Compliance at
property.label: consent41

property.name: consent42
property.default: irb@tgen.org.
property.label: consent42

property.name: consent43
property.default: If you have questions about your rights as a research participant in this study or if you have questions, concerns or complaints about the research, you may contact WCG IRB at:
property.label: consent43

property.name: consent_text_12
property.default: If you would like a copy of the consent form for your records,
property.label: consent_text_12

property.name: consent_text_13
property.default: click here to print one
property.label: consent_text_13

property.name: consent_text_15
property.default: I AGREE
property.label: consent_text_15

property.name: strTitle
property.default: Welcome in Salesforce
property.label: Enter the title
